job_name: Full-Stack Engineer - Inclusive Social Commerce PWA
description:
Lips is looking for a full-stack engineer to build the majority of our front and backend of a progressive web app. The ideal candidate is dedicated to building a more inclusive internet and has some familiarity with AI/ML and Blockchain technologies. 
This is a paid position, with possible equity and leadership position opportunities. We are based in San Diego, CA but are a distributed team. This is a remote position.
Primary Languages:

Node.js
Javascript
Python

Note: This is a progressive web app! Prior experience with PWAs is required. 
Key skills/features needed: 

Encryption (Cryptographic Login - preferably built on public blockchain - our blockchain advisor can work with you on this) 
Foundation of Code is Machine Learning Friendly (we use this to moderate) 
Progressive Web App https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2016/08/a-beginners-guide-to-progressive-web-apps/ 
Foundation of Code is Blockchain Friendly - Java, Node.js (we will be using a public blockchain TBD, all posts will be automatically uploaded to the blockchain to protect identity - again we will have a blockchain advisor helping with this) 
Admin Web module
API Development
Deployment and Servers setup in Microsoft Azure, IBM or Serverless

Lips offers tools for creators to promote, grow and sell their products. 

Analytics, Insights Dashboard for SaaS customers
Animations for customizability features such as drag and drop, similar to Plann App (https://www.plannthat.com)

Integrations:

Shopify for automatic setup of marketplace 
Third Party Payment for Secure Transactions - Segpay, Paxum, CC Bill, Epoch
Cryptocurrency payments through intimate.io 
Firebase for Analytics
Branch for deep linking on sharing
ZenDesk for Customer Support
Emails with YNOT Mail 

Women, BIPOC, LGBTQIA candidates encouraged to apply.

location: San Francisco ‚Ä¢ San Francisco Bay Area
description:
Matter is looking for a talented, friendly and thoughtful Full-Stack Engineer to join us in creating the future of feedback. As one of the first 20 employees at Matter, you‚Äôll get to work on our most interesting and impactful challenges. Together, we can help professionals everywhere reach their career aspirations and achieve their professional goals.
You‚Äôll work across the entire Web stack (JavaScript, Node.js, CSS, React, GraphQL, SQL, AWS), collaborating closely with other engineers, product managers, and designers. You‚Äôll contribute to the product-development process, developing beautiful, intuitive UIs and powerful, scalable backend APIs. You‚Äôll write well-tested, maintainable code, and help drive the direction of our growing architecture.
A little bit about you:

You love making beautiful, and delightful Web experiences.
You‚Äôve been building Web applications professionally for 5+ years.
You have experience working at a startup.
You have experience with frontend frameworks ‚Äî e.g., React, Angular, or Ember.
You are fluent in a programming language such as JavaScript, Python, Ruby, Go, C, or Java. (Our stack is mostly JavaScript, but we love polyglots.)
You are familiar with CSS, and CSS preprocessors such as Sass or LESS.
You are a strong communicator. Explaining complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other engineers is no problem for you.
You can balance idealism with pragmatism.
You currently live in, or are willing to relocate to, the San Francisco Bay Area.

Bonus points:

You have experience with open source.
You have built and maintained complex Web frontends with React.
You have experience with testing frameworks such as Mocha, Jest, Karma, QUnit, Cypress, or TestCafe.
You have experience with backend frameworks, such as Express, Rails, or Django.
You have experience with build tools such as Lerna, Yarn, or Webpack.
You are comfortable writing raw SQL, and understand how ORMs work.

job_name: Full Stack Developer with React, Typescript and Python
description:
What you will do
As part of the WeGetFinancing development team, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining different components of our platform.
You will be working side to side with the CTO, you will participate in biweekly sprints, releasing quality code using test-driven development practices, and writing good technical documentation.
You will work with a modern stack (https://stackshare.io/wegetfinancing/wegetfinancing) using innovative frameworks using Python 3 and React, being always on the edge of the technology.
If you are a very passionate software engineer that follows engineering best practices and in search of constant growth, this offer is for you, giving you day-to-day challenges and learning opportunities.
What you need to bring

+2 years of experience building innovative websites and/or mobile applications.
+2 years of experience with Python, Typescript and React.
HTML and CSS knowledge.
Experience with TDD (test-driven development), Unit Testing, Q&A.
Knowledge of engineering patterns such as DRY, KISS, SOLID, etc.
University degree in Computer Science or related.
Fluency (both written and spoken) in English.

Bonus points if

Previous experience with Agile methodology
Knowledge of Git and git-flow
Knowledge of Selenium or similar testing frameworks.
Experience with eCommerce applications.
Experience developing microservices for the cloud (with AWS or similar).
Portfolio of previous works and any related links to GitHub/BitBucket public repositories with relevant projects.

skills: ['Machine Learning', 'Backend Development', 'Frontend Development', 'REST APIs', 'Music Information Retrieval', 'React.js', 'Python/Django/Flask']
description:
We are looking for a full-stack developer to engineer the front-end and the backend code for our web application. This is a short-term contract role, with potentially rolling in to full-time. Candidate must dedicate at least 20 hrs/week for this project. 
No software development agencies.
Our AI application assesses an artist's audio files and estimates if they are going to trend or chart in the next 6 - 12 months, predictions are delivered in real-time. This means artists can be vetted quicker and connect with established labels, fast.
We spent the past year researching and fine-tuning our deep learning models. It is trained on one of the most extensive datasets on music. The UX/UI design is complete and researched.
We rely heavily on the following tools and technologies below ‚Äì but you don't need to have prior experience in all of them. We don't mind what languages or frameworks you've used before (in fact, different experiences bring different perspectives to the table) - we‚Äôre just keen to know that you're willing to break things, fix things, learn fast and carry on creating. 
Flask for backend development
React for frontend development
D3.js, Plotly or Bokeh for charting
PostgreSQL for persistent data storage
Kafka for our asynchronous message queue
Google Cloud for our infrastructure
Nice to have
Experience with Music Information Retrival technologies
Experience working with machine learning projects in production

Game Developer Required!
Game developer with practical experience in game development is required to build 2D games as part of a mobile application built with React Native technology. The app works mainly on iOS and Android based tablets and the games will be part of the app.
The developer will build a series of 40 or more games to be plugged into our mobile app, using any suitable game development tool/framework as long as it can be integrated with our mobile app.
We are open for full time hiring or freelancing job, qualified candidates please submit your resumes to this email: jobs@adamwamishmish.com

Job Description
We are looking for a Node.js Developer responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and the users. Your primary focus will be the development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your co-workers into the application. Therefore, a basic understanding of front-end technologies is necessary as well.
Responsibilities

    Integration of user-facing elements developed by front-end developers with server side logic
    Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code
    Design and implementation of low-latency, high-availability, and performant applications
    Implementation of security and data protection
    Integration of data storage solutions, postgres

Skills And Qualifications

    Strong proficiency with JavaScript 
    Knowledge of Node.js and frameworks available for it Express,etc. 
    Understanding the nature of asynchronous programming and its quirks and workarounds
    Basic understanding of front-end technologies, such as HTML5, and CSS3
    User authentication and authorization between multiple systems, servers, and environments
    Integration of multiple data sources and databases into one system
    Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
    Creating database schemas that represent and support business processes
    Implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests
    Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git

hiring_contact: Lauren Trahan, Office Manager, HR, Recruitment ‚Ä¢ 3 years
description:
Hi! We appreciate you reading our job post. Jackrabbit Mobile is an Austin-based technology consultancy founded in 2012. We partner with our clients to accelerate product-to-market solutions by leveraging our product, user experience, and software expertise.
Location: Our team is fully remote. Looking for someone in Pacific, Central, or Eastern Time Zones. 
Engagement: We are looking to work with a contract part-time flutter developer for a minimum 3 month term.
Start date: Two weeks.
Opportunity: Mobile is the core of our expertise at Jackrabbit. As a Google Flutter Developer, you will be responsible for the full development process from application development and technical architecture to code review and test build distribution within the agile development process framework. You will work within our cross-functional teams to communicate development progress and capabilities with clients to deliver innovative digital products.
Compensation: Hourly rate negotiable based on experience.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Google Flutter application development
Technical architecture
Debugging
Application testing
Code review
Test build distribution
Agile process participation
Regular reports and updates
Client communication

3-6 years experience in the following:

Working in cross-functional teams, including design
Developing with agile & scrum processes 
Modern tooling: Slack, GitHub, Trello, JIRA

Building an app from the ground up
Networking and API communication
Architecture, MVP and MVVM
Google Flutter and their complete UI Toolkit (minimum one year experience)

Capable of working unsupervised, self-starter

A GOOD FIT WOULD BE SOMEONE WHO IS
Professional - interacts with many different levels of people, clients, and team members

Modern - familiar with the latest developments in technology and development tools
Excited - work with awesome people & tech, you should love it as much as we do!

industry: ['Social Games', 'Web Design', 'Design', 'Mobile Games', 'Ticketing', 'Apps', 'Technology', 'Web Development', 'Events Services', 'Live Entertainment', 'Graphic Design']
description:
Gramercy Tech is looking for a well rounded software developer to join our team!
At Gramercy, we work on a wide range of cutting edge technologies, from facial recognition and AR, to digital projection games and NFC ticketing systems. Most of our projects are created for live events, so timelines tend to be short and developers are able to work on many varied projects throughout the year.
Of course, live events are not happening at the moment, but we are still busy working on remote conferencing tools! Our entire team is currently remote, but the office is based in Manhattan, so you should be in the region if you are interested in being in an office once the world re-opens.
The ideal candidate will have an extensive background in software development, and will be looking to join a creative and close-knit team.
Requirements and Qualifications:

4+ years working in software development broadly
2+ years working in front end experience, (ideally specifically with React)
Familiarity with at least one backend software development language (Ruby on Rails, or PHP)
Understanding of relational database systems and experience with MySQL or PostegreSQL)
Proficient in working with command line tools-experience developing in OSX or Linux
Interested in working on interactive technologies

CoWorkr is a leading Workplace Analytics company using sensors to generate real-time data on workplace occupancy and rich analytics for real estate strategists. We build our own hardware and software to offer a complete end-to-end service to global customers. Our technology is now helping major corporations with their return to workplace strategy. We provide real-time data on safe distancing measures, kiosks to help staff find available and unused seats/rooms, analytics for planning, and daily use maps for janitorial staff. Since inception in 2014, our tech has been deployed in 200+ unique workplaces globally including the offices of LinkedIn, Salesforce, HSBC, Henkel, WSP, and Paychex. CoWorkr has collected over 5M days of data and is distributed by CBRE, JLL, Haworth, iOffice, and more.
Our technology includes:
Hardware-enabled software (Bluetooth Sensors that stream data to a Cloud)
Meteor- and Javascript- based web app that visualizes real-time and historical data
API for integrating data with partner apps
We are seeking a Fullstack Engineer with a focus on frontend and UX. You will be involved in the entire software development process to ensure quality and value throughout the entire product but expected to have experience in building beautiful frontends. In detail this will include building dashboards that utilize real-time and historical sensor data as well as other software dev tasks. You will be working on a small team under our CoFounder and CTO.
What You‚Äôll Do:
Codesign and Implement new front end features
Maintain App through testing/ bug fixing
Maintain and implement new data sources into the app‚Äôs analytics
Perform needed technical and nontechnical tasks throughout the entire platform
What You Bring:
3+ years in a Software Development and/or Fullstack Engineering role
Minimum Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science (or another STEM discipline) 
Expert with Javascript, CoffeeScript, MongoDB, RestAPI, HTML, CSS, Meteor, and Python
Ability to self-manage and be autonomous among a distributed team in an agile environment
Fluent in english and authorized to work in the US
What We Bring: 
Startup CultureFlexible work hours
Work-from-Home
Medical, Dental, Vision
Performance based option grants
Flexible PTO

WHAT YOU NEED:
Our ideal candidate has 3+ years software development experience using:

JavaScript, Typescript
Angular 5+ (MUST HAVE)
Firebase
Git
Plusses:


Experience with backend Node and Electron
Experience with Google Cloud. 
Ability to complete all phases of software development life cycle including analysis, functionality, testing and support.


PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

Fluency in English, Spanish a plus.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

WHAT YOU GET:

Compensation packages consisting of either a Full Time Contract OR Salary + Equity.
The opportunity to build innovative technology in the booming Collaboration Tech market.
Get in on the ground floor as one of the first 5 employees at a venture backed startup.
Live and work remotely.

Outschool's mission is to inspire kids to love learning. We believe the best way to do that is by linking learning to kids‚Äô interests, connecting them with others who share those interests, and giving them the autonomy to pick their own path. We provide small group classes that meet over live video chat where learners are connected with teachers and classmates who share their interests. These classes are offered through our marketplace and conducted on our remote learning platform.
We're an experienced team with past accomplishments at Airbnb, Square, Apple, Uber, Udemy, Amazon, Google, and many startups. We came together because we wanted to make a difference in education, and saw the opportunity to empower learners, teachers, and parents. Now, in the face of mass school closures, our product and expertise has become central to many more families and organizations than ever before. Our business is growing explosively and as of July, 400,000 learners have taken more than over 1.3M class hours. We've already doubled our team so far this year to keep up with growth. As well as growing our business, we're committed to access and impact so we founded outschool.org to offer $1M in financial assistance to families in need. We're Series A stage, have raised $22M in funding and are profitable.
We are an effective team of senior engineers, getting a lot done by staying focused on the work that matters. We're iteratively building up a complex product for a highly engaged audience. Upcoming projects include data-driven recommendations, measuring teacher quality and learner engagement, learner profiles, integrated messaging, assignments, learning paths, growth experiments, better search, and more.
We work in modern JavaScript: React, GraphQL/Apollo, and Node/Express backed by PostgreSQL.
Here are some reasons to join us

Collaborative team culture that encourages pairing, iteration, and impact
Novel vision to transform kids' education through remote teaching with live video chat
Experienced team from Airbnb, Square, Amazon, Google, Udemy and Clever
Lots of opportunities to make an impact by building large features end-to-end
Consumer product with fast iteration cycles means you can have a big impact in a short time
Proven, fast-growing marketplace business with millions of dollars in annual revenue
Funded by top education and marketplace investors, Reach Capital and Union Square Ventures

We look for candidates who

Have been programming professionally and challenging themselves for at least 2 years
Communicate clearly 
Balance big-picture perspective with attention to detail
Take responsibility for their work
Care about learning and education
Have something to teach us

Must be a citizen or legal resident of the U.S. or Canada and reside in U.S. or Canada.
Outschool is an equal opportunity employer. We view diversity as a moral imperative and a competitive advantage. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We plan and structure our interviews to directly assess skills and experience.

Web and Mobile App Developer/Support Job Responsibilities:
The role is responsible for designing, coding and modifying websites, from layout to function and according to company specifications. Strive to create visually appealing sites that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation. Concurrently a Mobile Application will require development, support and maintenance as changes and updates are needed.
Web and Mobile App Developer/Support Job Duties:
‚Ä¢ Understanding of HIPAA regulations and standards 
‚Ä¢ Ability to scope and apply your expertise to many interesting technical problems.
‚Ä¢ Candidate must have a strong understanding of UI, cross-browser compatibility, general web functions and standards.
‚Ä¢ The position requires constant communication with colleagues.
‚Ä¢ Experience in planning and delivering software platforms used across multiple products and organizational units.
‚Ä¢ Deep expertise and hands on experience with Web Applications and programming languages such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery and API's.
‚Ä¢ Deep expertise and hands on experience with iOS Mobile Applications and programming languages such as xCode and Swift
‚Ä¢ Deep functional knowledge or hands on design experience with Web Services both IIS and Apache
‚Ä¢ Strong grasp of security principles and how they apply to E-Commerce applications.
‚Ä¢ Strong debugging and an ability to apply critical thought to problem solving

Web and Mobile App Engineer Skills and Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ PHP, JavaScript, JQuery, HTML, HTML5, CSS, CSS3
‚Ä¢ Web Programming Skills, iOS, Objective C, Swift
‚Ä¢ XCode,  iTunes Connect, App Loader, Test Flight
‚Ä¢ Cross-browser compatibility, Web User Interface Design (UI), Security Principles, Object-Oriented Design, Web Services (REST/SOAP), Multimedia Content Development, API's
‚Ä¢ Teamwork and Verbal Communication

Note: This role is W2 only and the person must be US-based.
WHO WE ARE:
We are an event technology company that has pivoted to virtual events during the pandemic, and are pioneering the space with highly custom, interactive live web experiences for major brands. We are looking for part-time help as we scale up in this new space (opportunity to turn into full time as more projects come in).
Most of our projects involve a custom-built website, including several ‚Äúrooms‚Äù, each of which is a page that includes lightly interactive elements, streams, chat, etc. The browser experience is desktop first, but also needs to be responsive.
WHO YOU ARE: 
Front end skills / React whiz. Backend skills with Node.js experience. Experience with production-grade web applications with sophisticated animations and designs with highly custom user interface elements, client-side routing that accounts for users with different permission levels and animated transitions, embedded video (and possible streaming) elements. Experience integrating with APIs and custom backends. Three.js or any other interactive frameworks are a plus. Someone with experience in Node.js, building websites that potentially cater to high visitor traffic. Also need experience dealing with security requirements of major, global corporations. Will likely use AWS / Azure. Full stack developer is preferred but we're open to receiving applications from frontend and backend developers as well.
WHEN: Part-time position, starting in the next few weeks, opportunity to go full time if/when as we grow in the space.
PAY: Looking to pay in the range of 50-100+/hour roughly, DOE. Payment must be structured as a W2.

job_name: Senior Full Stack Engineer | 8 hours a week
description:
Watch our demo video here.
Who we are
Founded by Stanford and Berkeley grads, Areena is building the future of recreational sports. There are 50 million adults in America playing sports every year, but they are served right now by an old-school network of small organizations offering largely the same product they did 30 years ago. We are changing that in a big way by building a tech-centric platform that transforms the experience, making it far easier and more fun for anyone to play whatever sport they want, all year long.
Where we are
Having validated our business model and value proposition, we have joined the Capital Factory Accelerator and are stepping into the next phase of the startup journey - refining/expanding our product offering and scaling across Texas. 
What we‚Äôre looking for
We need a rock-star technical leader to join our team on a part time basis. You will spend 8-10 hours a week helping to guide our development in a unique builder / coach capacity. While you'll get your hands dirty building product, you'll also be either leading junior developers to execute your vision or helping develop the technical skills of the CEO.
Experience And Skills 

Masters / Bachelors degree required in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience 
Knowledge of our tech stack - React, Flutter, Python, AWS, MongoDB
5+ years of software engineering experience or equivalent
Proven track record of turning ideas into products
Working knowledge of designing and building web scale applications
Experience building API frameworks from scratch
Static and Dynamic programming language expertise
RDBMS Design and Scaling experience (Indexing, Partitioning, Normalization, De-normalization)
Working knowledge of ElasticSearch or other Lucene based search engines
Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, SCM, CI, build processes, unit and functional testing, automation, and operations 
Strong communication, organizational and time management skills

hiring_contact: Irin Son, Head of People ‚Ä¢ 7 months
description:
About AngelList Venture:
At AngelList, we exist to help startups save the world. We‚Äôre building the definitive platform for startups ‚Äî where they raise money through AngelList Venture, build teams through AngelList Talent, and launch their products through Product Hunt.
The venture team is fundamentally altering how startups raise money by replacing early-stage venture capital with modern technology. We've delivered over $1B to more than 3,000 startups over the past few years. Our infrastructure allows investors to build on top of AngelList instead of a traditional VC. This will result in a more innovative, efficient & fair market.
We recently celebrated our ten year anniversary. Here's a fun look back at exciting milestones and a preview of what to expect from AngelList Venture going forward: https://angel.co/blog/the-next-decade
About the Role:
AngelList Venture is seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our core engineering team. We have a small, tight-knit team (there's 7 of us) and we pride ourselves on having an outsized impact on the industry. Our offices are in Seattle and San Francisco, but we have team members all over the globe. Join us in our mission to innovate on the infrastructure of innovation. ‚úåÔ∏è
You will:

Help build the world's easiest-to-use financial platform (see https://t.co/7AmuxYWHe3 ‚Äì and we've made it easier since then).
Connect startups and investors around the world who would never have had a chance to meet without AngelList.
Know the venture financing business inside and out - from the ground up.
Take responsibility for the code you own and improve our codebase with your presence.
Ship every day.

You are:

A full-stack generalist with 3+ years experience building web applications.
Experienced at writing clean, scalable code with significant experience in one or more scripting languages.
Excited to move fast, prioritize, and constantly make critical product decisions.
Comfortable with and curious about working outside of a traditional narrow engineering role.
A self-starter: you have started something on your own before - a startup, an open-source project, something else.
A deep love of startups (https://venturehacks.com/save-the-world).

If you're interested in joining us, but don't tick every box above, we'd still encourage you to apply. We're building a diverse team whose skills balance and complement one another. We're happy to consider where you might be able to make the biggest impact.
Benefits & Perks : At AngelList Venture, we have top of the line benefits to support our employees in their lives both inside and outside of work. See additional detail on our benefits here: https://angell.ist/venture-benefits .
AngelList is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

*Please apply here: pwvconsultants.applytojob.com/apply/Obeuq6zBeG/Full-Stack-DeveloperPWV Consultants is looking for experienced Full Stack developers to join our team.¬†PWV is a boutique group of experts in the tech and design industries that are trusted by Fortune 500 companies, rising startups, universities, governments and industry groups to tackle their biggest and baddest tech issues.To best serve our clients you‚Äôll delve into new subject matter everyday, and you‚Äôll always be on the lookout for innovative ways to approach each project. We are looking for ever-curious, highly collaborative, and outcome oriented individuals who are not afraid to dive into new territory.You‚Äôll join a highly experienced cross-functional consulting team in developing custom web applications using amongst others: Javascript, Java, HTML5, CSS, Node, C++, Python. As well as implement and design modern infrastructure with AWS, Azure, Mongo, SQL. You might have a greater interest or knowledge in some of these technologies than others, but we‚Äôre looking for people who want to make well-rounded full stack contributions to everything they work on. We are less interested in what languages and tech you know and more interested in how you approach and understand coding.¬†¬†¬†¬†PWV is a 100% remote company whose team is distributed all over the United States. We value the experience of our devs and only take on projects that are interesting, contain challenging subject matter, or feature new/unexplored concepts. Our people work flexibly in the environment they choose on projects worthy of their talents.¬†Skills and Requirements:Professional experience working with some of the languages and the systems listed above or equivalents, for a minimum of 5 years.An expert grasp on OO and functional design patterns that avoid redundancy and promote efficiency, legibility, testability, and maintainability of code.Desire to collaborate and innovate with a highly experienced team.A track record of working with project management teams to achieve software development goals.Expert level communication and documentation.¬†Experience collaborating in distributed teams is a plus.
Software Engineer with full-stack experience and knowledge of IOS development(Swift).

skills: ['Software Engineering', 'Product Management', 'Team Player', 'Communication Skills', 'Mobile Application Development', 'Ability to work under pressures']
description: In charge of building the nuts and bolts of the application and eventually over seeing a team of engineers hired/vetted by you.There will be an opportunity for co-founder / equity parternship if applicant desires.

Overview:
I'm looking for someone to lead a junior developer that I've partnered with. The project is to continue developing DateSpot, the first marketplace connecting singles with matchmaking clients, across multiple companies. It's a unique dating site that's private, requires no messaging and allows human matchmakers to do the work in finding people love.
You would be an integral part of the company's vision and execution long-term. I'd like someone who wants to be part of the team, even if potentially and down the road, rather than someone at an agency who wants to stay there.
Tasks:
There are some high priority tasks that I'd like completed, and then potentially a complete refactor (there are currently two types of code). The roadmap includes mobile optimization, creating a CMS, new pages for referrals to other experts, and integrating data to apply filters that are game-changing in the industry. Down the road, I'd love to do AI integration and I'm totally open to ideas.
Requirements:

At least 1 year of professional coding experience out of school, and 3+ years preferred.
Intimate knowledge of Facebook React, Node/Express, and MongoDB.
Experience working in Digital Ocean
Knowledge of automated emails through SendGrid
Strategic thinking and you enjoy being asked a lot of questions about how we should do things on the site.
Comfortable with starting from other people's code, and in this case, different code styles across two different previous teams
Experience mentoring or teaching someone else in the coding space
Live in the U.S. (PST preferred)
You think that working in the dating industry would be fun!

Compensation:
DateSpot Inc. is a C-corp, so I'm open to you joining for full or partial equity. I'd like to do a test period with you as a contractor first to see how we work together as a team with the other developer - $500 initially, based on $50/hr. Past that point, we can talk about how we want to move forward - you alone, you with the current junior dev, or you with a different developer.
Let's do this and bring people love!

We are looking for a passionate Software Engineer excited about building sound solutions to interesting technical problems such as Color Search and Social Sharing. You will be hands-on working and growing in a small-team environment, helping us scale our business through the implementation of key technical initiatives.
Day-to-Day Responsibilities Include:
¬∑ Developing APIs and other functionality
¬∑ Providing support for defect resolution
¬∑ Providing support in project scoping
¬∑ Improving upon engineering processes
¬∑ Collaborating regularly both with the engineering team and other team members across the firm
¬∑ Attending daily standup
Preferred Qualifications:
¬∑ Excellent communication skills
¬∑ Proficiency with Java
¬∑ Proficiency with Spring Boot
¬∑ Proficiency developing RESTful APIs
¬∑ Understanding of Relational Databases and SQL
¬∑ Ability to thrive in a dynamic, rapid-growth environment
Compensation and hours:
We are looking for someone to work in a Part-Time capacity for the first three months for cash and equity, with the hope of hiring full-time with equity.
We are on a bootstrap budget, looking for someone interested in joining a high-growth startup as one of the first 10 employees. Early employees will be eligible to receive equity.
...
About Us:
Vishion is a color search engine for design lovers to find decor.
Location:
We are accepting remote applications.

Slumber Group is looking for a talented iOS Software Engineer to help develop exciting new features for our popular Sleep Apps.As an iOS Software Engineer you will be responsible for all technical aspects of planning and implementing new features.  The codebase is in Swift 5 and uses SnapKit for Auto Layout.The position is 100% remote and at least 1 year of experience working in a remote environment is required.You will have the opportunity for professional growth, work with the latest technologies, and help millions of users worldwide.Responsibilities (what you‚Äôll do): -Write and maintain high performance, reusable, and reliable code.-Collaborate with a cross-functional team to define, design, test, and ship new features.Qualifications (what you have): -1+ years working remotely.-3+ years of iOS development experience.-2+ years of database experience. -1+ years of writing views programmatically with Auto Layout.-1+ years consuming server APIs (networking and parsing JSON)-Strong working knowledge of the latest mobile development practices.-Experience with Git is required.How We Work-We respect work life balance with flexible working hours-We have ownership of how we complete work-We take responsibility for our outcomes -We are creative in how we approach problems-We share information and learn from each other -We pride ourselves on being adaptable because change is a constant-We focus on the customer-We make mistakes, learn and improve as we iterate-We focus on delivering value quickly and iterating on lessons learnedTechnologies you will work with (bonus if you already have experience):-SnapKit-Audio Frameworks-StoreKit-Core Data-Accessibility (Dynamic Type, Voice Over)Application Bonus:Include a cover letter with links to the App Store of apps you have personally worked on.

description:
BACKED is a data-driven CDC and SAG-AFTRA compliant COVID-19 solution and decision-making platform created to help companies navigate with dynamic risk analysis, compliance support, and policy execution.
As a Data Visualization Designer at BACKED you will design client facing dashboards that will save lives. You work will communicate danger and risk to encourage life-saving change and compliance. 

You are a visual thinker and builder, having a strong creative eye
Strong graphic design skills
Love data visualization
Marketing, Branding Material Creation
A background in video game design is a plus!
Front end developer capabilities would be an incredible plus

What we are building is incredible and as our second full time hire and first designer, you'll have a ton of impact ‚Äî both on how the product looks/feels/functions ‚Äî but also on the design culture we build together.
Salary Depends on Experience
3 Month Contract with the potential for full-time.

Do you seek the outdoors and adventure? Are you inspired by wild places and seek to inspire others? Do you promote sustainability? 
This is Lodestar ‚Äì and we‚Äôre seeking other highly motivated, experienced professionals with rockstar coding skills and a passion for adventure to join us in launching a one-of-a-kind community hub focused on outdoor recreation and travel. 
We are currently looking for a Full Stack Engineer.  You will be part of a small, experienced and dynamic, team responsible for the product from conception to deployment.  You should be at home with both front-end and back-end coding methodologies including multiple languages and development frameworks. You should also be a team player with a knack for visual design and utility.
Responsibilities
‚óè Design foundational elements to a technical POC client-side and server-side architecture
‚óè Build the front-end of applications through appealing visual design
‚óè Develop and manage well-functioning databases and applications
‚óè Write effective APIs
‚óè Test software to ensure responsiveness and efficiency
‚óè Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade software
‚óè Create security and data protection settings (i.e. cybersecurity)
‚óè Build features and applications with a mobile responsive design
Qualifications & Requirements
‚óè A passion for life and the outdoor adventures lived everyday
‚óè Excellent teamwork and communication skills
‚óè Multiple referenceable experiences developing successfully adopted scalable software solutions
‚óè Expert knowledge of multiple back-end languages (e.g. C#, Java, Python) and JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Node.js)
‚óè Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role lead technology role in a fast-pace start up environment
‚óè Expert design capability with databases (e.g. Postgre, Oracle), web servers (e.g. Apache) and UI/UX design
‚óè Expert knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery)
‚óè MS/BS Degree in Computer Science, Statistics or relevant field.

description:
Giftapart Inc. is an innovator in social ecommerce and changing the culture of gifting. Located in Somerville, NJ, the company seeks top-notch innovators and programmers to join our team of coders to continue development of our patent-pending new methods of ecommerce. Giftapart is founded and managed by its CEO Filipe Pedroso, an award winning attorney and elected public figure, with the guidance of its investors and Board composed of seasoned technology angel investors, business owners, and ex-Wall Street executive/NHL team owner.
Seeking experienced Android coders with proficient knowledge in Android SDK and Java. Knowledge of Retrofit and Kotlin a plus.
Must have knowledge and comfort level to work without supervision and technical support. Work is mostly remotely, but office location in Somerivlle, NJ is available for those who prefer in-office time.
Skills needed:

Android SDK (High profciency / Required)
Java (High profciency / Required)
Retrofit (Moderate proficiency / Bonus)
Kotlin (Moderate proficiency / Bonus)

This is primarily a remote position, paid hourly.
Giftapart is available on any browser as well as on Apple App and Google Play stores. Check it out:

Browser/Desktop/Tablet: https://giftapart.com
Apple App Store
Google Play store

We've looking for talented, top-rated people to join our team.

SpotlightAI is an early-stage AI startup, incubated out of Harvard and MIT. Our vision - create a world where data is shared safely and securely. Join an exciting, VC-backed company and work hand-in-hand building a cutting-edge platform.
We are looking for a contract/part-time Python developer with some basic experience in NLP (basic terminology and understanding of natural language concepts).
Basic Qualifications:

High level of proficiency in Python
Basic knowledge of Docker
5-10 hours/wk. availability

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with spaCy, NLTK or similar framework
Experience in API development
Basic knowledge of Kubernetes

About Dosis
We're a small, but mighty team making a big impact. In less than three years, we‚Äôve gone from bootstrapping to a profitable company with a proven business model. We‚Äôre growing every day, and have some exciting milestones in 2020. We couldn‚Äôt have made it this far without our amazing, dedicated team; each member is integral to the success of our company. Now, we‚Äôre looking for the latest member to join us! 
What we do
We're revolutionizing the way drugs are dosed. Our flagship product is an AI-powered web application that provides physicians with clear and concise analysis of their patients‚Äô conditions to help them make the best possible clinical decisions. We‚Äôre still in stealth mode, so you won‚Äôt find much about us online.
Dosis Ethos

Feel-good work. Our product helps improve the health of patients in our market. 
Humble and hungry. Every challenge is an opportunity to rise up ‚Äî and grow. 
No work is too small or too big. We roll up our sleeves and help each other.
Ownership and accountability. We‚Äôre proud of our work and invested in its results. 
Action-oriented. If we think of a good new idea, we always chase it!

Requirements

1+ years Ruby on Rails experience 
Detail-oriented ‚Ä¢ Emphasis on code quality 
Enthusiastic about technology and learning 
Proven ability to work well in small teams 
Reliable and dedicated to your work 
Curious 
Love solving complex problems 
Great communication and time management skills 
Always looking to improve

description:
About the Company and Candidate
Relevize is a fast-growing sales enablement and marketing technology platform that enables cutting-edge technology companies to leverage their business partnerships into scalable digital marketing and sales channels. Want to build a product for senior sales executives and CMO‚Äôs of fortune 500 companies?

We serve clients like Global Marketing Directors and Chief Revenue Officers at companies including Hulu, Microsoft, Amazon, HBO and more
Our end-users are innovative sales and marketing leaders at fast-growing technology companies like Stratus Technologies, Panzura.com, and more. These users are cutting-edge thinkers who are excited to help us build our product alongside our team
We are bootstrapped, currently cash-flow positive, achieved 10x revenue growth in 2019
Our CEO and CTO formerly built and sold a successful digital marketing business

UI Engineering Role (JavaScript)
What life looks like in this role
The Javascript UI Engineering role will work on a small team of engineers with daily team interactions on slack and will be a part of two company-wide team check-ins each week (40- minutes on Monday and 20-minutes on Thursday via Google Hangouts). The expectation is that you will be the most experienced and knowledgeable designer on the engineering team. You will be asked to contribute to decisions and will be seen as the leading authority when it comes to design decisions. You can expect to regularly contribute to low-level day to day front end development tasks that may be urgent as well as building out the overarching design structure that the product requires. You should be comfortable working independently, have the ability to bring new ideas to the table through experience and work in a highly creative and fast-paced environment. You will be expected to polish the user interface and experience of our product, while also understanding that we are a fast-growing startup and the product may change rapidly. The candidate must be comfortable with:

Being highly creative, autonomous and highly effective on a small team
His or her UI and UX work becoming critical and a massive difference maker to the company‚Äôs overall success
Developing his or her own processes and structure around the role
The risks and rewards associated with joining an early-stage software company

What success looks like in this role
Success in this role is closely-tied to and inseparable from the company‚Äôs overall success. Success in this role means:

Higher utilization of our software by both our clients and our client‚Äôs partners who also have accounts on our platform. This utilization can also be in the form of automation of cumbersome service-based tasks currently being completed by the customer success team
Renewals and expansion from current clients. Our top company goal is to provide enough value to clients that they expand the use of our software nationally or internationally thereby increasing the duration and value of their contracts with our company
Skills required to succeed in this role*

Javascript and UI knowledge with a strong understanding of:

Front-end Frameworks: We use Vue, but any JavaScript framework experience is okay
NPM-based workflow
UI/UX and responsive design o CSS rules

Web Performance and how different technology usage affects page load speed and time to interaction
Iterative design process that integrates with development workflow
Wireframe/mockup/protype process: balsamiq, sketch, build it yourself, we want to hear how you do things
Additional Skills:

Photoshop/Illustrator or similar experience. Do you have a design portfolio?
Webpack configuration experience: have you set up webpack before?
Test Writing: We use jest but any testing experience is welcome

Please reach out to mike@relevize.io with sample work or relevant experience

What You'll Do:

You'll build and contribute to the architectural and design decisions your team makes, and articulate the impact of those decisions 
You'll break down new features into releasable chunks, estimate release schedule, and work on creating the features with your team 
You and your team get to create impactful features for our customers, and you'll influence your team members to take ownership and always do the right thing

About You:

5+ years of iOS app development experience 
You have a proven ability to build, launch and iterate on apps
You have superior analytical skills and a strong sense of ownership in your work
You have a proven customer facing application development, troubleshooting, deployment and application performance tuning experience 
You have very strong development skills in Swift, iOS SDK, and good general programming and algorithm skills
iOS enthusiast who wants to innovate and help us out with our mission
You thrive in a startup environment where you'll juggle different priorities and iterate quickly

Ready for your next big challenge?
We‚Äôre looking for someone spectacular - a Full Stack Developer to join us on this once-in-a-lifetime, roller-coaster ride, "take no prisoners" opportunity that is guaranteed to change the face of sports, entertainment, and data for years to come. Ask questions, look deep inside yourself, and if it seems like a match, let‚Äôs hop on the phone and get to know each other.
"Great - but what is a pumpjack datawork?"
Pumpjack Dataworks (PJD) is building a platform to manage, access, value, and exchange data for sports teams across the globe. We're already working with loads of top tier teams such as the Dallas Mavericks, the Philadelphia Eagles, and Inter Miami FC (who knows, maybe you'll even get to meet David Beckham once you're on the team)!
We've closed a successful investment round, have multiple investments from industry leaders, and are rapidly marching toward a huge Series A. We're gearing up for this rocket ride and want to bring some incredible people along with us!
Primary Responsibilities

Collaborate with the team to further the FanXP Platform
Design and develop complex features using full stack JavaScript libraries
Maintain, build, and consume node REST and GraphQL APIs that are consumed by both React applications and native mobile applications
Interact with and help maintain Postgres databases
Guide scope, estimation, and technical delivery during iterations and releases
Develop subject matter expertise in different domains

Required Experience (Mid-Level)

3 years professional development experience
At least 2 years building and maintaining production Node/Express applications
At least 2 years experience building and maintain React/Redux applications
A working knowledge of how to use git
Professional experience with PostgreSQL (or any SQL database) and Redis
Experience developing GraphQL based services
Professional experience with AWS considered a plus
Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies considered a plus
Knowledge of unit and integration testing best practices

Small Project
We require a small project to start with that should take ‚â§ 8 hours max. We want to ensure we are a good fit and that you are setup to succeed before we invest in each other.
What we offer

Opportunity: With a small, core team of talented people, iterating and scaling fast, you‚Äôll be hands-on and learning right away.
Location: We have two amazing offices - Dallas and Fort Worth, but offer remote opportunities anywhere in the US or Canada
Culture: We strive to be welcoming and inclusive. As a core team member, you‚Äôll be active in recruiting decisions ensuring we build a culture you want to be part of.
Salary: A competitive salary with stock options.
Benefits: Option to join a Health, Vision and Dental benefits plan with growing benefits as the company is growing. For contractors, insurance benefits follow a probation period.
Time-Off: Flexible PTO
Sports Access: We offer opportunities to meet with professional sports franchises and engage with some events (live and virtual)

Please note: Individuals must be legally authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.

We are seeking a Magento 2 experienced Technical Solutions Architect & Developer who is a strong leader and collaborative teammate. A major part of this role is to review and improve our current system processes. This will entail understanding the history of these processes, building relationships with stakeholders, making recommendations based on best practices, and reaching decisions through consensus. Experience in change management would be helpful.
You will be asked to oversee the actions of our developer team, responding to queries as they arise. Maintaining project quality and time-lines is required. Your technical expertise will matter as much as your ability to engage with our team and skillfully and empathetically identify pain points and create action plans. You will need to collaborate with the technical team, clients and account managers to help deliver continuity in our project management process while defining requirements in the preparation of roadmaps and technical specifications. 
Responsibilities:
Building relationships with our remotely distributed team, including Project Managers, Developers, and Project Coordinators
Leading the team in technical direction during development by leading the decision-making process
Reviewing and improving current processes and documentation
Providing technical oversight to the development team
Creating regular reporting on project progress and milestones
Providing insight and effectively communicating with colleagues and clients how solutions will be implemented
Developing solutions for internal and client projects
Establishing code review and testing processes for improved product delivery
Requirements:
At least 4+ years of Magento experience (Certification is a plus!)
Experienced in leading teams
Organized, detail-oriented
4+ years of eCommerce development experience
4+ years of PHP experience
4+ years of MySQL experience
Excellent verbal and written communication
2+ years of DevOps experience 
1+ year of experience developing solutions using headless technologies, for example, GraphQL, PWA Storefront and JavaScript SDK
Flexible work schedule to complement primary office hours between 7AM and 4PM PST Monday - Friday.
